perturbation.original_text: The term of the Agreement will be for 12 months unless terminated sooner. This agreement may be renewed upon mutual, written agreement of the parties. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time with 30 days written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of the Agreement will be for 12 months unless terminated sooner. This agreement may be renewed upon mutual, written agreement of the parties. Either party may terminate this Agreement only after a written notice of 60 days and with a penalty of $10,000, which should be paid to the other party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a 30-day written notice for termination without penalty, while the modified version requires 60 days notice and a $10,000 penalty. This creates a contradiction regarding the conditions under which the agreement can be terminated.

perturbation.original_text: AVDU agrees that it will put in place, if it has not already done so, policies and procedures relating to and addressing, with the commercially reasonable intent to ensure compliance with, applicable securities laws, rules and regulations, including, but not limited to: A. The use, release or other publication of forward-looking statements. B. Disclosure requirements regarding the required disclosure of the nature and terms of UTK's relationship with, including, but not limited to press releases, publications on its web site, letters to investors and telephone or other personal communication with potential or current investors. C. No press releases or any other forms of communication to third parties which mention both UTK CORPORATION and AVDU, shall be released without the prior written consent and approval of both UTK and AVDU. D. EXECUTION. The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement, in the time and manner herein specified will not conflict with, result in a breach of, or constitute a default under any existing agreement, indenture, or other instrument to which either AVDU OR UTK is a party or by which either entity may be bound or affected.
perturbation.changed_text: AVDU agrees that it will put in place, if it has not already done so, policies and procedures relating to and addressing, with the commercially reasonable intent to ensure compliance with, applicable securities laws, rules and regulations, including, but not limited to: A. The use, release or other publication of forward-looking statements. B. Disclosure requirements regarding the required disclosure of the nature and terms of UTK's relationship with, including, but not limited to press releases, publications on its web site, letters to investors and telephone or other personal communication with potential or current investors. C. No press releases or any other forms of communication to third parties which mention both UTK CORPORATION and AVDU, shall be released without the prior written consent and approval of both UTK and AVDU. D. EXECUTION. The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement, in the time and manner herein specified may conflict with, result in a breach of, or constitute a default under any existing agreement, indenture, or other instrument to which either AVDU OR UTK is a party or by which either entity may be bound or affected.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the execution of the agreement will *not* conflict with other agreements, providing assurance. The modified text states the execution of the agreement *may* conflict with other agreements, creating uncertainty and potential breach risk. This contradiction affects the reliance parties can place on the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: UTK agrees to provide the following distinct services to AVDU: i. Identify synergistic new technologies from universities and government laboratories to help provide AVDU with an enhanced new product pipeline. ii. Review technology acquisition opportunities for AVDU while maintaining AVDU's confidentiality. iii. Present technology acquisition opportunities for AVDU. AVDU will have 30-days to determine if they want to go forward with the technology license. a. UTK after 30 days shall have the right to present the technology to other clients. iv. AVDU acknowledges that the sources of technologies represented by UTEK are 3rd party research institutions for which UTEK does not control whether the technology will be shown to other parties by the licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: UTK agrees to provide the following distinct services to AVDU: i. Identify synergistic new technologies from universities and government laboratories to help provide AVDU with an enhanced new product pipeline. ii. Review technology acquisition opportunities for AVDU while maintaining AVDU's confidentiality. iii. Present technology acquisition opportunities for AVDU. AVDU will have 30-days to determine if they want to go forward with the technology license. a. UTK after 30 days shall present the technology to other clients. iv. AVDU acknowledges that the sources of technologies represented by UTEK are 3rd party research institutions for which UTEK *does* control whether the technology will be shown to other parties by the licensor.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mentions after 30 days, UTK *shall have the right* to present the technology to other clients, implying an option. The modified version changes it to *shall* present the technology to other clients, making it an obligation. The other contradiction is that the original text says UTK does *not* control whether technology will be shown to other parties, whereas the modified one says that it *does* control it. This changes the degree of control that UTEK has, and also creates an obligation to the other clients which can be confusing.
